question1.question: The marketing manager at Universal Containers is sending communication emails out to customers and wants to track the open rates over the next few weeks. They are only sending a small number of emails. What should the App Builder recommend to meet these requirements?
question1.option1text: Use a third-party tool and integrate it into Salesforce.
question1.option1textexplanation: Incorrect. This is not the ideal solution as customers can get apps that extend functionality through Salesforce AppExchange.
question1.option2text: Download an app from AppExchange to extend functionality.
question1.option2textexplanation: Correct. You can get apps on AppExchange to extend the functionality of the tool. AppExchange is the official Salesforce app marketplace to get applications that meet our security and trust requirements.
question1.option3text: Outsource a contractor to develop a custom app just for this requirement.
question1.option3textexplanation: Incorrect. This is not an ideal solution. The cost and time to develop a custom tool would go beyond the date when the marketing manager would need the tool. Instead, the contractor should consider downloading an app from AppExchange to extend functionality.
question1.option4text: Use a third-party platform that meets these requirements.
question1.option4textexplanation: Incorrect. This is not the ideal solution as customers can get apps that extend functionality and use cases through Salesforce AppExchange.

question2.question: A sales manager from Universal Containers wants to assign leads that come in from their website to queues. What standard process can the App Builder recommend?
question2.option1text: Create an apex class that sorts leads into queues.
question2.option1textexplanation: Incorrect. The best way to sort leads that come in from a website is to use lead queues to create a lead assignment rule and activate it.
question2.option2text: Create a manual process to sort leads into queues.
question2.option2textexplanation: Incorrect. Leads can be automated using a lead assignment rule to sort leads that come in from a website into lead queues. Create a lead assignment rule and activate it.
question2.option3text: Create a lead assignment rule that sorts leads into queues.
question2.option3textexplanation: Correct. First, create a lead queue and select a default owner in lead settings for the leads that donâ€™t meet the assignment criteria. Then create a lead assignment rule and activate it.
question2.option4text: Create a default lead owner who sorts leads into queues.
question2.option4textexplanation: Incorrect. This will not work because lead owners cannot filter leads into queues. Only lead assignment rules can filter leads based on assignment criteria in a lead assignment rule. The best way to sort leads that come in from a website is to use lead queues, create a lead assignment rule and activate it.

question3.question: In order to delete Opportunities, Universal Containers would like sales reps to submit requests for approval from their sales manager. What can be used to meet these requirements?
question3.option1text: Process Builder with an auto submit for approval action
question3.option1textexplanation: Incorrect: While Process Builder meets the requirement for the approval scenario, this still leaves the requirement of deleting the opportunities once approved.
question3.option2text: Approval Process with an Apex Trigger
question3.option2textexplanation: Correct: An Approval Process to submit the opportunity for delete and a trigger to delete the Opportunity once approved.
question3.option3textexplanation: Incorrect: A two-step approval process is not needed.
question3.option4text: Approval Process with Time-Dependent Workflow action
question3.option4textexplanation: Incorrect: A time-dependent workflow action does not have the capability to delete an Opportunity.
